Uses of Class
fr.minuskube.inv.util.ItemBuilder

  • Packages that use ItemBuilder 
    Package Description
    fr.minuskube.inv.util
    Lists all the other util classes related to the SmartInvs API.

    • Uses of ItemBuilder in fr.minuskube.inv.util

      Methods in fr.minuskube.inv.util that return ItemBuilder 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.amount​(int amount)
      Sets a new amount for this item stack
      ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.appendLore​(String line)
      Appends the given line to the end of the lore.
      static ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.builder​(ClickableItem item)
      Create a new ItemBuilder instance based on the existing stack in the clickable item

      The stack is copied using ItemStack(ItemStack)
      static ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.builder​(ItemStack stack)
      Create a new ItemBuilder instance based on an existing stack.
      static ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.builder​(Material material)
      Create a new ItemBuilder instance creating an ItemStack with the given material
      static ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.builder​(Material material, int amount)
      Create a new ItemBuilder instance creating an ItemStack with the given material and amount
      ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.enchantment​(Enchantment enchantment)
      Adds an enchantment with the level 1 to the item stack
      ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.enchantment​(Enchantment enchantment, int level)
      Adds an enchantment directly to the item stack without level restrictions
      ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.leatherColor​(Color color)
      Applies the given color to the item if the item is leather armor, so it MUST be one of the following LEATHER_HELMET LEATHER_CHESTPLATE LEATHER_LEGGINGS LEATHER_BOOTS
      ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.lore​(String lore)
      Sets the lore to the given string.
      ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.lore​(String[] lore)
      Sets the lore for the item based on the string array passed to it
      ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.lore​(List<String> lore)
      Sets the lore for the item based on the string array passed to it
      ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.name​(String displayName)
      Sets the displayName of the item to the given input
      ItemBuilder ItemBuilder.removeLore​(String line)
      Removes a line from the current lore using List.remove(Object)
